conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container E or F after passing through baffles.
Container A is positioned at the top left, and its liquid stream meets an angled yellow baffle sloping leftward.
Liquid from A travels down the yellow baffle and is deflected leftward into the white collection channel leading to outlet E.
Container B is positioned next to A, and its liquid stream meets an angled green baffle sloping leftward.
Liquid from B travels down the green baffle and is deflected leftward into the white collection channel leading to outlet E.
Container C is positioned next to B, and its liquid stream meets an angled cyan baffle sloping rightward.
Liquid from C travels down the cyan baffle and is deflected rightward into the blue collection channel leading to outlet F.
Container D is positioned next to C, and its liquid stream meets an angled gray baffle sloping rightward.
Liquid from D travels down the gray baffle and is deflected rightward into the blue collection channel leading to outlet F.
Liquid from A and B ends up in outlet E, while liquid from C and D ends up in outlet F.
